Sentence: One day Pip is taken by his (his) Uncle Pumblechook to play at Satis House, the home of the wealthy dowager Miss Havisham, who is extremely eccentric: she (Havisham) wears an old wedding dress everywhere she (Havisham) goes and keeps all the clocks in her (Havisham) house stopped at the same time
With Miss Havisham's guidance, Pip is apprenticed to his (his) brother-in-law, Joe, who is the village blacksmith
Pip happily assumes that his (benefactor) previous hopes have come true--that Miss Havisham is his (benefactor) secret benefactor and that the old woman intends for him (benefactor) to marry Estella
Orlick reappears in Pip's life, employed as Miss Havisham's porter, but is promptly fired by Jaggers after Pip reveals Orlick's unsavory past
Several years go by, until one night a familiar figure barges into Pip's room--the convict, Magwitch, who stuns Pip by announcing that he (Orlick), not Miss Havisham, is the source of Pip's fortune
A complicated mystery begins to fall into place when Pip discovers that Compeyson was the man who abandoned Miss Havisham at the altar and that Estella is Magwitch's daughter
Pip was merely a boy for the young Estella to practice on; Miss Havisham delighted in Estella's ability to toy with his (boy) affections
Pip makes a visit to Satis House, where Miss Havisham begs his (Bentley) forgiveness for the way she (Havisham) has treated him (Bentley) in the past, and he (Bentley) forgives her (Havisham)
